text:
League 1
ASSE: the message of the supporters before Monaco
While the two kops are closed for the reception of Monaco, supporters of the ASSE have still been able to hang a banner about the sanctions against the stands.
03 Nov 2019, 19:20 by Antoine Chirat



Harold MoukoudiClub previous: Le HavreTransfer fee: noneIcon Sport



Jean-Eudes Aholou Previous club: AS MonacoTransfer fee: none (ready) Icon Sport



Alpha SissokoClub previous: ClermontTransfer allowance: noneIcon Sport



Yohan CabayeClub previous: without clubTransfer fee: noneIcon Sport



Sergi PalenciaClub previous: FC BarcelonaTransfer allowance: 2 M ‚Ç¨ Icon Sport



Miguel TraucoClub previous: FlamengoTransfer allowance: 1 M ‚Ç¨ Icon Sport



Denis BouangaClub previous: N√Æmes OlympiqueTransfer fee: ‚Ç¨ 4.5 M Icon Sport



Ryad BoudebouzClub previous: Betis SevillaTransfer allowance: 3.5 M ‚Ç¨ Icon Sport



Zaydou Youssouf Previous club: Girondins de BordeauxTransfer allowance: 2 M ‚Ç¨ Icon Sport

ASSE: all the recruits of the transfer window 2019




Following the use of pyrotechnic equipment in the derby won against OL (1-0), the LFP decided to heavily sanction the two "kops" Stade Geoffroy-Guichard two games behind closed doors. Tonight, the Cauldron will sound hollow, but the fans have still been able to display their discontent, including the broadcaster Canal +: "540 million euros per year for closed stands! So Canal +, happy?". Last year, Canal + had claimed compensation from the LFP following the lags of many meetings due to the events of the yellow vests. Canal + could once again have a bad look at its sanctions reducing the show in the stands and therefore the broadcast of the match in prime time on Sunday night.
